ME Millennium Station Elevator
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use the Museum Campus or McCormick Place elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

The 79th Street Chatham elevator will be out of service on Monday February 3rd, 9am to 2pm

The 79th Street Chatham elevator will be out of service on Monday February 3rd from the hours of 9am to 2pm. Customers can use 83rd Street Avalon Park or 75th Street Grand Crossing as alternate boarding stations.

The Van Buren Street Michigan Avenue elevator is out of service.
The Van Buren Street Michigan Avenue elevator is out of service. Customers can use Millennium Station South Water or Museum Campus as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

The Ivanhoe elevator is out of service. Customers can use Harvey or 115th Street/Kensington as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

Flossmoor Elevator Out of Service
The Flossmoor elevator is out of service. Customers can use Calumet as alternate boarding station. Updates will be provided.

Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric 103rd Station Closed - Full Reconstruction

As part of the Metra Electric Community Initiative to transform 13 stations on the district, the 103rd Street/Rosemoor station remains closed for a full reconstruction and is expected to reopen next spring. During this time, customers can use 107th Street and 95th Street/Chicago State University as alternatives. For additional information click here.

Metra Alert ME - Track Construction Saturday, February 1 through Sunday, February 2

Track construction will be taking place on Saturday, February 1 through Sunday, February 2. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 30 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.

Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.

Metra Alert ME - 79th Street/Chatham Station
The 79th Street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric may not be fully ADA accessible Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.   Click here for more information.
